dev:remarks.maml:para: Adds a Database Mail Account to the specified SQL Server instance.

command:example.maml:title: --------- Example 2 ---------
command:example.dev:code: $SmoServer = Connect-SmoServer -ServerInstance MyServer Add-SqlDatabaseMailAccount -SmoServerObject $SmoServer -MailAccountName 'MyAccount' -Description 'My Mail Account' -EmailDisplayName 'SQL Server' -EmailAddress 'sqlserver@company.com' -SmtpServerName 'smtp.company.com' -SmtpServerPort 587 -UseSslConnection $true -SMTPAuthenticationType 'Basic' -Credential (Get-Credential)

dev:remarks.maml:para: Adds a Database Mail Account to the specified SQL Server instance using the SmoServer session.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves SQL Database Mail Accounts from a SQL Server instance.
Retrieves SQL Database Mail Accounts from a specified SQL Server instance or SMO Server object. You can optionally filter the results by specifying a Mail Account Name.
The name of the Mail Account to retrieve. If not specified, all Mail Accounts will be returned.
The name of the SQL Server instance to connect to.
The name of the Mail Account to retrieve. If not specified, all Mail Accounts will be returned.
An existing SMO Server object representing the SQL Server instance.
The name of the Mail Account to retrieve. If not specified, all Mail Accounts will be returned.
The name of the SQL Server instance to connect to.
An existing SMO Server object representing the SQL Server instance.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves the specified Database Mail account from the SQL Server instance "MyServer".
Retrieves the specified Database Mail account from the SQL Server instance using the SmoServer session.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves SQL Database Mail Configuration values from a SQL Server instance.
This cmdlet connects to a specified SQL Server instance and retrieves the Database Mail Configuration values. It can return all configuration values or a specific one based on the provided name.
The name of the specific Database Mail Configuration value to retrieve. If not provided, all configuration values will be returned.
The name of the SQL Server instance to connect to.
The name of the specific Database Mail Configuration value to retrieve. If not provided, all configuration values will be returned.
An existing SMO Server object representing the SQL Server instance.
The name of the specific Database Mail Configuration value to retrieve. If not provided, all configuration values will be returned.
The name of the SQL Server instance to connect to.
An existing SMO Server object representing the SQL Server instance.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves all Database Mail configuration values from the SQL Server instance "MyServer".
Retrieves all Database Mail configuration values sing the SmoServer session.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves Database Mail profiles from a SQL Server instance.

The Get-SqlDatabaseMailProfile cmdlet connects to a specified SQL Server instance and retrieves Database Mail profiles. You can specify a particular profile by name or retrieve all profiles available on the server.
The name of the Database Mail profile to retrieve. If not specified, all profiles will be returned
The name of the SQL Server instance to connect to.
The name of the Database Mail profile to retrieve. If not specified, all profiles will be returned
An existing SMO Server object representing the SQL Server instance.
The name of the Database Mail profile to retrieve. If not specified, all profiles will be returned
The name of the SQL Server instance to connect to.
An existing SMO Server object representing the SQL Server instance.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves the specified Database Mail profile from the SQL Server instance "MyServer".
Retrieves the specified Database Mail profile from the SQL Server using the SmoServer session.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves Database Mail profile accounts from a SQL Server instance.

This cmdlet connects to a specified SQL Server instance and retrieves Database Mail profile accounts. You can specify the server instance directly or provide an existing SMO Server object. Additionally, you can filter the results by profile name and account name.
The name of the Database Mail account to retrieve.
The name of the Database Mail profile to filter the accounts.
The name of the SQL Server instance to connect to.
The name of the Database Mail account to retrieve.
The name of the Database Mail profile to filter the accounts.
An existing SMO Server object representing the SQL Server instance.
The name of the Database Mail account to retrieve.
The name of the Database Mail profile to filter the accounts.
The name of the SQL Server instance to connect to.
An existing SMO Server object representing the SQL Server instance.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves a specific Database Mail Account from the specified SQL Server instance.
Retrieves a specific Database Mail Account using the SmoServer session.

maml:description.maml:para: Get the principals associated with a Database Mail profile.
Retrieves the principals (users or roles) that have access to a specified Database Mail profile on a SQL Server instance.
The name of the Database Mail profile for which to retrieve principals.
The name of a specific principal to filter the results. If not provided, all principals associated with the profile will be returned.
The name of the SQL Server instance to connect to.
The name of the Database Mail profile for which to retrieve principals.
The name of a specific principal to filter the results. If not provided, all principals associated with the profile will be returned.
An existing SMO Server object representing the SQL Server instance.
The name of the Database Mail profile for which to retrieve principals.
The name of a specific principal to filter the results. If not provided, all principals associated with the profile will be returned.
The name of the SQL Server instance to connect to.
An existing SMO Server object representing the SQL Server instance.

Retrieves all principals for the specified Database Mail profile using the SmoServer session.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves the protocol settings for a SQL Server instance.

The Get-SqlServerProtocol cmdlet connects to a specified SQL Server instance and retrieves the protocol settings, such as TCP/IP, Named Pipes, and Shared Memory. It returns a Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Smo.Wmi.ServerProtocol object that contains information about the protocol configuration.
Specifies the SQL Server protocol.
The name of the SQL Server instance to connect to.
Specifies the SQL Server protocol.
An existing SMO Server object representing the SQL Server instance.
Specifies the SQL Server protocol.
The name of the SQL Server instance to connect to.
An existing SMO Server object representing the SQL Server instance.

The name of the SQL Server instance to connect to.

The current name of the Database Mail Profile to be modified.
The new name for the Database Mail Profile.
An existing SMO Server object representing the SQL Server instance.
A new description for the Database Mail Profile.
The current name of the Database Mail Profile to be modified.
The new name for the Database Mail Profile.
The name of the SQL Server instance to connect to.
An existing SMO Server object representing the SQL Server instance.

command:example.maml:title: --------- Example 1 ---------
command:example.dev:code: Set-SqlDatabaseMailProfile -ServerInstance "MyServer" -MailProfileName "OldProfileName" -NewMailProfileName "NewProfileName" -Description "Updated description for the mail profile."

dev:remarks.maml:para: Sets the name and description of an existing SQL Database Mail profile on the specified server instance.

command:example.maml:title: --------- Example 2 ---------
command:example.dev:code: $SmoServer = Connect-SmoServer -ServerInstance MyServer Set-SqlDatabaseMailProfile -SmoServerObject $SmoServer -MailProfileName "OldProfileName" -NewMailProfileName "NewProfileName" -Description "Updated description for the mail profile."

dev:remarks.maml:para: Sets the name and description of an existing SQL Database Mail profile using the SmoServer session.

maml:description.maml:para: Set properties for SQL Server network protocols.
Sets properties for SQL Server network protocols such as SSL encryption, instance visibility, and extended protection.
The thumbprint of the certificate to use for SSL encryption.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Specifies whether extended protection is enabled for connections.
Specifies whether the SQL Server instance is hidden from the network.
Specifies whether encryption is required for connections.
Specifies whether strict encryption is required for connections.
The name of the SQL Server instance to connect to.
Restart the SQL Server service after making changes.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
